results.title: Metformin Suppresses LPS-Induced Inflammatory Responses in Macrophage and Ameliorates Allergic Contact Dermatitis in Mice via Autophagy.
results.text_hl: In addition, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ ameliorated @<m>DISEASE_Dermatitis_Allergic_Contact</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017449 @@@ACD@@@ partly through the inhibition of macrophage activation and the induction of autophagic flux.

citations.NLM: Wang M, Qu S, Ma J, Wang X, Yang Y. Metformin Suppresses LPS-Induced Inflammatory Responses in Macrophage and Ameliorates Allergic Contact Dermatitis in Mice via Autophagy. Biol Pharm Bull. 2020;43(1):129-137. PMID: 31902918
citations.BibTeX: @article{31902918, title={Metformin Suppresses LPS-Induced Inflammatory Responses in Macrophage and Ameliorates Allergic Contact Dermatitis in Mice via Autophagy.}, author={Wang M and Qu S and Ma J and Wang X and Yang Y}, journal={Biol Pharm Bull}, volume={43}, number={1}, pages={129-137}}

results.title: A Molecular Perspective on the Potential Benefits of Metformin for the Treatment of Inflammatory Skin Disorders
results.text_hl: Numerous research groups have reported that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ has beneficial effects on a variety of @DISEASE_Skin_Abnormalities @DISEASE_MESH:D012868 @@@inflammatory skin disorders@@@ including @DISEASE_Psoriasis @DISEASE_MESH:D011565 @@@psoriasis@@@, @DISEASE_Acanthosis_Nigricans @DISEASE_MESH:D000052 @@@acanthosis nigricans@@@, @DISEASE_Acne_Vulgaris @DISEASE_MESH:D000152 @@@acne@@@, @DISEASE_Hidradenitis_Suppurativa @DISEASE_MESH:D017497 @@@hidradenitis suppurativa@@@, and @<m>DISEASE_Dermatitis_Allergic_Contact</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017449 @@@allergic contact dermatitis@@@.

citations.NLM: Chang JE, Choi MS. A Molecular Perspective on the Potential Benefits of Metformin for the Treatment of Inflammatory Skin Disorders Int J Mol Sci. 2020 Nov 25;21(23):. PMID: 33255783
citations.BibTeX: @article{33255783, title={A Molecular Perspective on the Potential Benefits of Metformin for the Treatment of Inflammatory Skin Disorders}, author={Chang JE and Choi MS}, journal={Int J Mol Sci}, volume={21}, number={23}}

results.title: Differential effects of metformin on immune-mediated and androgen-mediated non-cancer skin diseases in diabetes patients: a retrospective cohort study.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: To investigate immune-mediated (@DISEASE_Urticaria @DISEASE_MESH:D014581 @@@urticaria@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Dermatitis_Allergic_Contact</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017449 @@@allergic contact dermatitis@@@ and @DISEASE_Psoriasis @DISEASE_MESH:D011565 @@@psoriasis@@@) and androgen-mediated (@DISEASE_Acanthosis_Nigricans @DISEASE_MESH:D000052 @@@acanthosis nigricans@@@, @DISEASE_Hidradenitis_Suppurativa @DISEASE_MESH:D017497 @@@hidradenitis suppurativa@@@ and @DISEASE_Acne_Vulgaris @DISEASE_MESH:D000152 @@@acne@@@) @DISEASE_Skin_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D012871 @@@skin diseases@@@ associated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ use.

citations.NLM: Tseng CH. Differential effects of metformin on immune-mediated and androgen-mediated non-cancer skin diseases in diabetes patients: a retrospective cohort study. Dermatology. 2023 Mar 15;():. PMID: 36921584
